text: Erling Mandelmann (18 November 1935 - 14 January 2018) was a Danish photographer. He began his career as a freelance photojournalist in the mid-1960s. He was born in Copenhagen. He took more than 500 portraits of people, including the 14th Dalai Lama, Noël Coward, Gertrude Fehr, Nina Hagen, Johnny Hallyday, and Prince Hans-Adam of Liechtenstein. His photo-archives have been deposited at the Historical Museum of Lausanne. Mandelmann died on 14 January 2018 in Paris of an aortic aneurysm at the age of 82.Le photographe Erling Mandelmann est décédé ==Gallery== Andrés Segovia (1963) by Erling Mandelmann.jpg|Andrés Segovia (1963) Christo by Erling Mandelmann (cropped).jpg|Christo (1972) Georges Simenon (1963) by Erling Mandelmann.jpg|Georges Simenon (1963) Marcel Marceau (1963) by Erling Mandelmann.jpg|Marcel Marceau (1963) Peyo (1990) by Erling Mandelmann.jpg|Peyo (1990) ==References== ==Other websites== * Personal website * Portraits of celebrities * Swiss foundation for photography Category:2018 deaths Category:1935 births Category:Deaths from aortic aneurysm Category:Photographers Category:Danish journalists Category:People from Copenhagen
